    Getting started with SupplyChain365

    To get started quickly and learn to Operate SupplyChain365, we have created a feature in the SupplyChain365 Extension called "demo-data". Starting from an empty company, this feature will fill Business Central with the information needed to demonstrate & test most of the capabilities and features of SupplyChain365, For the demo-data we use an imaginary company called SkyNet. From the movie picture Terminator featuring Arnold Schwarzenegger. SkyNet is a manufacturer and whole seller of Drones. The demo-data contains customers, vendors, items, orders, locations, employees etc. But more importantly, the demo data is completely configured so that all the features and capabilities are ready to go. This way you do not have to spend time configuring the system before you can use the APP to proces a picking order with a mobile device for example. With every update of the Extension the demo-data will be updated as well to demo and test specific scenarios or new features that have been added.

    We recommend using a Sandbox Environment with a blank (production setup data only) Company, when you want to get started and learn SupplyChain365 . Installing the SupplyChain365 Extension into a company in a Sandbox environment will not influence any production systems or databases.

    TABLE OF CONTENTS

    Getting started Checklist Watch Getting started with SupplyChain365 video

    Getting started Checklist Before you get started make sure you have followed these steps first:

    Registered your tenant at: the SupplyChain365 Registration Portal Login to the SupplyChain365 portal at: https://portal.supplychain365.net Install SupplyChain365 Extension from AppSource into your Environment Grant consent on behalf of your organisation Check that you have licenses on the SupplyChain365 Portal > Admin > Licenses Either you have trail licenses from your trail period You have purchased licenses on the portal Link Business Central Environments to SupplyChain365 Portal If you have not completed these steps, please go to How to register for SupplyChain365 and follow these steps before you can get started.
